column4: I have read 'man telinit' but not understood in what situation one would instruct 'telinit 2'.
telinit 2 tells init to change to runlevel 2
if you are already in runlevel 2, it's pointless
I know that and I have asked in what situations I might need to to give such an instruction.
for example if you have defined runlevel 5 as a set of services without sshd and without gdm, you would change to that set of services with telinit 5 (or simply init 5)
